Name: Naos of Nectanebo the First with God Horus
Description: This naos of Nectanebo the First is a masterpiece cut from a single block of granite. The top of the naos is shaped like a pyramid, and a statue of the falcon god Horus stands inside it. The protective winged sun disk symbol appears both on the front of the naos top, and also on the frame below the pyramid. On either side, columns of hieroglyphics are inscribed with the names and titles of King Nectanebo the First, starting with his Horus name.
